group_1.textRight: Oh, a convenience store. Do you guys want me@to buy you some drinks?

group_1.textLeft: Sounds great!
Huh, there's an interestin' flyer on the wall.

group_1.narration: Campsite-Organized Treasure Hunt Orienteering!@Anyone can participate by purchasing an entry form.

group_1.textRight: Hmm... Cheap entry fee, suitable for children?

group_1.textLeft: Let's have a little fun.

group_1.textRight: No way! We don't have time to goof off@right now!
The First Sister and the others are worried@about us, y'know.
You sure love taking the scenic route, huh?

group_1.textLeft: What, you chicken?

group_1.textRight: ...Excuse me?

group_1.textLeft: If ya don't think you can find the treasure,@then I guess there's no helpin' it...

group_1.textRight: HUH?! Hold on a sec.@It's not that I'm not confident or anything.

group_1.textLeft: So you're in, yeah?

group_1.textRight: If you're gonna put it like that,@then I can't back down.

group_1.textCenter: Hey! Is this really the time to be playing@around?

group_1.textRight: This isn't a game; it's a serious competition.

group_1.textLeft: Alright, here's where we split up!

group_1.textRight: See you later.

group_1.textLeft: They left...

group_1.textRight: ...[wait:0.8][chara:302101:lipSynch_1]I can't believe this.
...How's it looking?@Does it seem like it's gonna work again?

group_1.textLeft: I'm so sorry that we broke your phone, Sister...
I'm more troubled by how much you're@apologizing...

group_1.textRight: But we really do feel bad...

group_1.textLeft: Then how about this?
I will accept your apologies, and we'll call@the matter settled.
Does that sound alright?

group_1.textRight: ...I'm okay with it if you are, Yuna.
Me too...

group_1.textLeft: That said, I would like to get in touch with@Juri's group.
May I borrow someone's phone?

group_1.textRight: You can use mine. It's waterproof.
I left it inside the house, though...

group_1.textLeft: Thank you.
I'll go fetch it. You two can keep playing.
And I'll bring some floats and water guns back@with me as well.

group_1.textRight: You're goin' above and beyond!

group_1.textLeft: Heh heh, it makes me happy to see you girls@happy and having fun.

group_1.textRight: Well, let's get back to having fun then!

group_1.textLeft: *Sigh* It's no use. I still can't get in touch with@anyone on Yuna's end.

group_1.textRight: And I can't get through to the Second Sister...

group_1.textLeft: Seems like Juri and Ranka aren't planning@on quitting...

group_1.textRight: What are we gonna do now?

group_1.textLeft: There's no point in hanging around here,@so let's head up to the villa by ourselves.
...I just hope they don't forget where we were@originally going.
Guess this is our next stop for orienteering.

group_1.textRight: A cave... Huh, some kinda special stage...?

group_1.textLeft: This is always where you find the good shit.

group_1.textRight: Ooh, like exploring a dungeon in an RPG!
I'm getting kinda excited.

group_1.textLeft: I mean, if you look closely, you can tell that@it's man-made.

group_1.textRight: ...Don't say things to suck the wind out@of my sails.

group_1.textLeft: Hahaha!

group_1.textRight: We made it to the campsite, but...
This is one lost little kid, see, no two ways@about it!
W-what do we do...?

group_1.textLeft: I-I'll keep an eye on her for now.
Can you contact the campsite's lost child center?

group_1.textRight: Right away!
